Guideline: Use App Router for all projects
Description: App Router is the only recommended approach in Next.js 16
Do: app/ directory with page.tsx

Description: Create routes by adding files in app directory
Do: page.tsx for routes layout.tsx for layouts

Description: Keep components styles tests with their routes
Do: Component files alongside page.tsx

Description: Group routes without affecting URL
Do: (parentheses) for route groups

Description: Use loading.tsx for route-level Suspense boundaries
Do: loading.tsx alongside page.tsx

Description: Catch errors at route level with error boundaries
Do: error.tsx with reset function

Description: Server Components reduce client JS bundle - this is the default in Next.js 16
Do: Keep components as Server Components unless they need interactivity

Description: 'use client' directive required for interactive components using hooks or browser APIs
Do: Add 'use client' only for useState useEffect onClick etc
Code Good: 'use client'; export default function Counter() { const [c, setC] = useState(0) }

Description: Keep Client Components as leaf nodes to maximize Server Component tree
Do: Client wrapper for interactive parts only - extract small interactive pieces
Don't: Mark entire page as Client Component

Description: Stream content with Suspense boundaries for progressive rendering
Do: Suspense for slow data fetches with skeleton fallbacks
Don't: Wait for all data before rendering anything

Description: Next.js 16 supports PPR - static shell with dynamic Suspense holes
Do: Static shell + Suspense boundaries for dynamic parts
Don't: Full dynamic or full static pages
Code Bad: Entire page as SSR or SSG

Description: Fetch directly in async Server Components - no useEffect needed
Do: async function Page() { const data = await fetch() }

Guideline: Default fetch is uncached in Next.js 15+
Description: Since Next.js 15 fetch is NOT cached by default - must opt-in explicitly
Do: Explicitly set cache: 'force-cache' or use 'use cache' for static data
Don't: Assume fetch results are cached (they are NOT)

Description: Replace unstable_cache with 'use cache' directive for caching functions or components
Do: 'use cache' at top of async function or component file
Code Good: 'use cache'; export async function getProducts() { return db.product.findMany() }

Description: Control cache duration with cacheLife() inside 'use cache' functions
Do: cacheLife('hours') or cacheLife({ stale: 300 revalidate: 60 }) with 'use cache'
Don't: Hardcoded revalidate numbers without semantic meaning

Description: Tag cached data for surgical revalidation with revalidateTag()
Do: cacheTag('products') inside 'use cache' + revalidateTag('products') in Server Action
Code Good: 'use cache'; cacheTag('user-' + id); return await getUser(id)

Description: Server Actions replace API routes for form submissions and mutations
Do: action={serverAction} in forms or direct call in event handlers
Don't: Creating API routes for every mutation
Code Good: 'use server'; export async function createPost(formData: FormData) { }

Description: Use revalidatePath/revalidateTag after Server Actions to update cached data
Do: revalidatePath or revalidateTag after mutation

Description: Schedule logging/analytics after response is sent using after() from next/server
Do: after(async () => await logAnalytics())
Code Good: import { after } from 'next/server'; after(() => log(event)); return data
Code Bad: await logAnalytics(); return data // blocks response

Description: Automatic image optimization with WebP/AVIF lazy loading and srcset
Do: <Image> component with width height alt
Code Good: <Image src={hero} alt='Dashboard preview' width={800} height={600} priority />

Description: Prevent CLS (Cumulative Layout Shift) with explicit dimensions
Do: width and height props or fill with sizes

Description: Fill container with object-fit for responsive layouts
Do: fill prop with relative parent + sizes attribute

Description: Whitelist external image sources in next.config
Do: remotePatterns in next.config.ts with protocol hostname pathname
Don't: Allow all domains or use deprecated domains config

Description: Mark above-the-fold hero images as priority for faster loading
Do: priority prop on hero/banner images only
Don't: priority on every image or on below-fold images

Description: Self-hosted Google fonts with automatic optimization and no external requests
Do: next/font/google or next/font/local with variable and subsets
Code Good: import { Inter } from 'next/font/google'; const inter = Inter({ subsets: ['latin'], variable: '--font-inter' })

Guideline: Apply font via CSS variable in layout
Description: Set font variable on body in root layout for global usage
Do: className with font variable on body + CSS var() in Tailwind
Code Bad: Each page imports its own font

Description: Single variable font file covers all weights reducing bundle size
Do: Variable font with subsets

Description: Generate metadata based on route params for SEO
Do: export async function generateMetadata({ params })
Code Good: export async function generateMetadata({ params }) { const post = await getPost(params.slug); return { title: post.title } }
Code Bad: export const metadata = { title: 'Blog Post' } // same for all posts

Description: Add OG images for social sharing previews
Do: opengraph-image.tsx or images array in metadata

Guideline: Use metadata API not head tags
Description: Export metadata object or generateMetadata instead of manual head tags
Do: export const metadata = { title description }
Code Good: export const metadata: Metadata = { title: 'Home', description: '...' }

Guideline: Use Route Handlers for external APIs
Description: app/api routes for REST endpoints consumed by external services
Do: app/api/users/route.ts with exported HTTP method functions
Don't: pages/api (legacy) or creating API routes for internal mutations

Description: Use NextResponse.json() for proper HTTP responses with headers
Do: NextResponse.json() with status codes and headers
Code Bad: return { data } // not a valid Response

Description: Each HTTP method is a separate exported function
Do: Export GET POST PUT DELETE PATCH as named functions
Don't: Single handler with switch on method
Code Good: export async function GET() { } export async function POST() { }

Description: Validate all request bodies and params before processing
Do: Zod schema.parse() for type-safe validation

Description: Use proxy.ts to forward requests to external APIs without exposing them to client
Do: proxy.ts in app/api directory for external API forwarding
Don't: Exposing external API keys in client-side fetch calls
Code Good: // app/api/proxy.ts - forwards to external service securely

Guideline: Use middleware for auth and redirects
Description: middleware.ts at project root for authentication guards and redirects
Do: middleware.ts with matcher for protected routes
Don't: Auth check in every page component
Code Good: export function middleware(request: NextRequest) { if (!token) return NextResponse.redirect('/sign-in') }

Description: Configure middleware matcher to run only on needed routes
Do: config.matcher for specific route patterns
Don't: Running middleware on all routes including static assets
Code Bad: No matcher config // runs on every request

Description: Middleware runs on Edge runtime with limited API surface
Do: Edge-compatible code only (no fs no Node.js APIs)
Code Bad: import fs from 'fs' // NOT available in Edge

Description: Only env vars with NEXT_PUBLIC_ prefix are exposed to browser
Do: NEXT_PUBLIC_ prefix for client-accessible values
Don't: Server secrets exposed to client code
Code Bad: process.env.DATABASE_URL // undefined in browser but SECRET if exposed

Description: Check required env vars exist at build/start time to fail fast
Do: Validation in instrumentation.ts or env schema with Zod
Don't: Runtime crashes from undefined env vars

Description: Use .env.local (gitignored) for development secrets
Do: .env.local with secrets + .env.example for documentation

Description: Identify large dependencies and optimize imports
Do: ANALYZE=true npm run build to inspect bundles

Description: Code split with next/dynamic to lazy-load components not needed on initial render
Do: dynamic() with ssr: false for client-only heavy components
Don't: Import everything statically at top level

Description: Reserve space for async content to avoid CLS
Do: Skeleton loaders matching final layout dimensions

Description: Prefetching and client-side transitions with Link component
Do: <Link href='/about'> for all internal navigation

Description: Disable prefetch for low-priority or authenticated routes
Do: prefetch={false} for low-priority links
Don't: Prefetching all links including heavy authenticated pages

Description: next/form extends HTML form with prefetching and client-side navigation
Do: import Form from 'next/form' with action prop for progressive enhancement

Description: useActionState replaces useFormState for managing Server Action results
Do: useActionState(serverAction, initialState) for form + error state
Don't: useState + manual error handling for forms
Code Bad: const [error, setError] = useState(); const handleSubmit = async () => { try { await createUser() } catch(e) { setError(e) } }

Description: useFormStatus provides pending state inside form children for submit buttons
Do: <SubmitButton/> component using useFormStatus() inside the form
Don't: Passing loading prop manually from parent
Code Good: function SubmitBtn() { const { pending } = useFormStatus(); return <button disabled={pending}>{pending ? 'Saving...' : 'Save'}</button> }

Description: Next.js 16 supports TypeScript config file natively
Do: next.config.ts with NextConfig type
Code Good: import type { NextConfig } from 'next'; const config: NextConfig = {}; export default config

Description: Catch potential issues and double-rendering in development
Do: reactStrictMode: true (default in Next.js 16)

Guideline: Configure redirects and rewrites in config
Description: Use config for URL management instead of middleware for simple cases
Do: redirects() rewrites() in next.config.ts
Don't: Manual redirect handling in every page
Code Good: async redirects() { return [{ source: '/old', destination: '/new', permanent: true }] }
Code Bad: Middleware redirect for simple URL changes

Description: Never trust or render user input without sanitization
Do: Escape sanitize and validate all user input
Don't: Direct interpolation of user data into HTML

Description: Content Security Policy prevents XSS attacks
Do: CSP headers in next.config.ts or middleware

Description: Server Actions are public HTTP endpoints - always validate and authorize
Do: Auth check + Zod validation inside every Server Action
Don't: Trust Server Action input without validation
Code Good: 'use server'; const session = await auth(); if (!session) throw new Error('Unauthorized'); const data = schema.parse(formData)
Code Bad: 'use server'; await db.user.delete(formData.get('id')) // no auth check

Description: New auth helpers for proper HTTP status codes in App Router
Do: forbidden() for 403, unauthorized() for 401 responses
Don't: Generic redirect to /login for all auth failures

Guideline: Turbopack is default for next dev in Next.js 16
Description: Turbopack replaces webpack as default dev bundler - much faster HMR
Do: next dev (uses Turbopack by default)
Don't: next dev --webpack unless you have specific webpack plugins

Description: Some Windows environments or complex webpack configs need --webpack fallback
Do: next dev --webpack if Turbopack crashes on your system
Don't: Giving up when Turbopack fails - try webpack mode
Code Good: next dev --webpack // fallback for Turbopack issues
Code Bad: Abandoning the project when dev server crashes

Guideline: next build uses Turbopack by default
Description: Next.js 16 build also uses Turbopack - use --webpack only if custom webpack config exists
Do: next build (Turbopack) for standard projects
Don't: --webpack for build unless you have custom webpack plugins in next.config
Code Bad: next build --webpack // only if custom webpack config needed

Guideline: ThemeProvider must always provide context during SSR
Description: When ThemeProvider has mounted/unmounted state the pre-mount branch must still wrap children in Context.Provider or useContext consumers will throw
Do: Always render Context.Provider even before mount - just provide default values
Don't: Returning bare children without Provider in unmounted state
Code Bad: if (!mounted) return <>{children}</> // useTheme() throws 'must be used within Provider'

Guideline: Never set NODE_ENV=production for dev server
Description: Next.js dev requires NODE_ENV=development - production NODE_ENV causes crashes and undefined behavior
Do: Ensure NODE_ENV=development when running next dev
Don't: Having NODE_ENV=production in environment while running dev
Code Bad: NODE_ENV=production next dev // causes startup crashes

Description: When useCache is not configured SWC options have undefined fields causing 'untagged enum Config' error
Do: Patch node_modules/next/dist/build/swc/options.js to default undefined fields to false
Don't: Ignoring SWC compilation errors with webpack mode
Code Bad: useCacheEnabled // undefined dropped by JSON.stringify crashes SWC binary

Description: Build fails with 'generate is not a function' when generateBuildId config is not set
Do: Patch generate-build-id.js: typeof generate === 'function' ? await generate() : null
Code Good: let buildId = typeof generate === 'function' ? await generate() : null
Code Bad: let buildId = await generate() // crashes if generate is undefined

Description: Turbopack may crash with 'Cannot read properties of undefined (reading replace)' on Windows
Do: Use --webpack flag as fallback on Windows if Turbopack fails
Don't: Assuming Turbopack works on all platforms
Code Bad: next dev --turbopack // may crash on Windows with certain setups

Description: sed and other Unix commands fail on Windows - use Node.js scripts instead
Do: node scripts/postinstall.js for cross-platform patching
Don't: sed awk or other Unix-only commands in postinstall

Description: Switching between Turbopack and webpack without cleaning cache causes stale manifest errors
Do: rm -rf .next before switching between --turbopack and --webpack
Don't: Switching bundler without cleaning build cache
Code Bad: next dev --webpack // after using turbopack - stale cache

Description: Reading localStorage/window in initial render causes hydration mismatch
Do: Use inline script in head for theme/locale or useState with useEffect pattern
Don't: Reading localStorage in component body during SSR
Code Bad: const theme = localStorage.getItem('theme') // undefined on server causes mismatch

Description: Next.js with pnpm needs shamefully-hoist=true in .npmrc or binaries may not be found
Do: Add shamefully-hoist=true to .npmrc for pnpm projects
Don't: Default pnpm strictness may hide Next.js binaries
Code Bad: pnpm install // next command not found without hoisting

Guideline: Use use() hook for reading promises and context
Description: React 19's use() hook can read promises in render and replaces useContext
Do: use(promise) in client components + use(Context) replacing useContext
Code Good: const data = use(fetchPromise) // suspends until resolved

Guideline: Use useOptimistic for instant UI feedback
Description: Show optimistic state immediately while Server Action is pending
Do: useOptimistic for instant UI updates that revert on error
Don't: Waiting for server response before updating UI
Code Bad: setLikes(prev => [...prev, newLike]); await serverAction() // laggy UI

Guideline: ref is a regular prop in React 19
Description: No need for forwardRef - ref is passed as a regular prop
Do: function Input({ ref ...props }) { return <input ref={ref} /> }
Code Bad: const Input = forwardRef((props, ref) => <input ref={ref} />) // unnecessary wrapper

Description: React 19 supports returning cleanup from ref callbacks for proper teardown
Do: Return cleanup function from ref callback
Don't: Manual cleanup in useEffect for ref-based subscriptions

Description: Tailwind v4 (used with Next.js 16) replaces @tailwind directives with CSS @import
Do: @import 'tailwindcss' in globals.css

Guideline: Use @theme for custom design tokens in Tailwind v4
Description: Tailwind v4 uses @theme block in CSS instead of tailwind.config.js for customization
Do: @theme inline { --color-primary: #1E40AF } in globals.css
Code Bad: module.exports = { theme: { extend: { colors: { primary: '#1E40AF' } } } } // v3 config

Description: Tailwind v4 uses @tailwindcss/postcss plugin instead of tailwindcss
Do: plugins: { '@tailwindcss/postcss': {} } in postcss.config.mjs
